item.title: Dead tree fallen across grass verge & pavement, 4th September
item.description:
Near the bus stop at Blackbrook Lane a dead tree has fallen from the edge of Jubilee Country Park. It needs removing.

item.title: Board for planned works in Royal Road/ Bexley Lane moved ., 4th September
item.description:
Someone has moved the information board for flood works due to start 15.9.25 Royal Road, Sidcup/ Bexley Lane. It needs to be re-positioned back to where it belongs.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 32, Onslow Drive, Albany Park, Sidcup, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Erection of barriers blocking pavement, 4th September
item.description:
The only pavement along Orme Court is out of action due to the erection of temporary hoarding (see attached photos). This is obviously problematic since there is no pavement on the other side so pedestrians will have to walk along the road which is quite dangerous given the proximity to the junction with Bayswater Road and lack of street lighting. I suspect there are also access concerns for wheelchair users and people with prams. Please can you advise how the council is addressing this.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 4-8, Orme Court, Bayswater, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flag painted on roundabout, 4th September
item.description:
Roundabout defaced with flag painted on it. Outside eardley arms pub on Woolwich road. Offensive and dangerous for drivers on the highway. Issue has been present a week now. I reported it a day ago and the reply sent claimed that it had been dealt with and erased. The problem still exists. Please advise. Many thanks.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 13A, Woolwich Road, Upper Belvedere, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Graffiti sprayed on black shoo shutter at 296-298 Brixton road SW9 6AG. The graffiti is on both front and side of the shutter. Has been there for over a week, 4th September
item.description:
I like to report graffiti sprayed on a black shop shutter at 296-298 Brixton road SW9. The shop is vacant. Unfortunately when graffiti this large is displayed more opportunists see it and spray alongside it. All the other graffiti sprayed on shop shutters have been removed and have vastly improved the main road. Please could this graffiti be removed it be very much appreciated.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 296,298, Brixton Road, Brixton, London
Report on FixMyStreet
